text: Hey <@U07VDRL4S87> - it depends what the global element is. If it's a custom module, you can add style-fields to it. If it's a section/partial/template HubSpot will automatically add default styling options to those and you can't hide/extend them. (That's why I recommend to use custom modules as often as possible :slightly_smiling_face: )

Ok, thanks for that :slightly_smiling_face:
I'm trying to add 2 color fields to the global content editor to create a gradient color in the background header

In this case I'd recommend to use pure CSS.
Just add a class with your gradient settings to your CSS file and the class to the header html.
Tipp: You can use the theme fields to add a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/cms/fields/module-theme-fields#gradient|gradient option> to the theme settings and use it for generating the whole css part
